pr_body: To add a basic driver skeleton for LTC2376 (single channel, 16-bit SAR ADC) along with its device tree overlay for Raspberry Pi3 and device tree binding documentation in yaml.

/*

it's a good idea to adapt the title from the datasheet", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 13, 15, 24, 56, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'commodo', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 453735110, 'comment_body': 'this is more important for upstream than for us;
but `MODULE_LICENSE("GPL");`  == `// SPDX-License-Identifier: GPL-2.0-or-later`
and `MODULE_LICENSE("GPL v2");` == `// SPDX-License-Identifier: GPL-2.0`  (or `// SPDX-License-Identifier: GPL-2.0-only`)

i don't know if it matter much whether it's GPL-v2-only or GPL-v2-or-later, but the `SPDX-License-Identifier` and `MODULE_LICENSE()` string need to match

we can leave it as-is here [for now]; but upstream may complain;
maybe they have some scripts to check this information [now];', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 13, 15, 29, 33, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'commodo', 'type': 'User'}]

pr_body:
Adds basic read raw functionality and buffer support. 
The frequency of the PWM can be varied and is used as a conversion signal for the device. The falling edge on the busy signal from the device provides hardware trigger for the buffer.
pr_review_comments: [{'comment_id': 474550335, 'comment_body': 'minor style comment: maybe stick with having _probe at the end in the name like ltc2376_trigger_probe', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 21, 9, 1, 42, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'buha', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 475931841, 'comment_body': "@meenalparakh , why do we have 2 channels (single-ended and differential) here? Shouldn't we have only the differential one?", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 24, 22, 35, 1, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'dbogdan', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 477085880, 'comment_body': 'I had originally thought that single channel would be used when LT6350 is used to convert the single ended input to differential. The single channel would have an offset of 2^15 and scale equal to v_ref/2^16. The differential channel will be used otherwise, with scale being 2*v_ref/(2^16) and no offset (as per Figure 2, page 10 in the data sheet (https://www.analog.com/media/en/technical-documentation/data-sheets/237616fa.pdf)) And so I made two channels.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 26, 7, 19, 1, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'meenalparakh', 'type': 'User'}]
